document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

sentence.text: Opponents lucky enough to escape Malawi to live in exile have sometimes been hunted down and assassinated or abducted by Malawian agents in Zambia or Zimbabwe .
The word escaped her in a small explosion of sound .
Leave it all behind you and cross the bridge beneath the restaurant that will help you escape south-west towards open country .
A solitary tear escaped his eye , and he cursed himself for it .
If the cell was sealed off and no gases escaped then all of the power would go into heating the electrolyte .
Her laughter escaped in little gusts and rushes .
Officials stressed that no radiation had escaped into the atmosphere and there was no danger to the environment .
An armed response unit reached the bank within minutes and a police helicopter hovered overhead , but the robber had escaped through the back of the building empty-handed .
It turned out that Killion had been in the cellar when the police came , and he escaped through a trapdoor into the street .
The family escaped to Chester and then settled , much impoverished , on their mother 's jointure estates in Yorkshire .
Far better to relax in your favourite armchair , enjoy a drink with your husband ( or wife ) and talk through today 's problems than escape with a mate for endless rounds of gin and tonic .
Her hair escaped in wayward fronds from beneath her brown velvet hat , and her eyes , of the same brown , were full of friendliness .
There 's another screech of brakes , and a van that should never have escaped out the scrapyard collapses shuddering in the road .

Built from the debris of planets , moons and comets , the sphere had originally been designed to completely enclose its star , collecting all the energy it gave out rather than letting the vast majority of it escape away into space .
If they were to escape back through the trench they would have to move quickly ; any moment now the sepoys would have crossed the yard from the hospital and outflanked them .

Much of the mercury that escapes in to the soil and the air and in to the water , finishes up here in the rivers , and there it reacts with naturally occurring compounds to form a compound called methyl mercury which is far more dangerous to man than is mercury itself .

From the ferry terminals on Hong Kong Island you can escape to islands without cars or cares , where the local people smile `` hello '' and , if you 're lucky , point you to a secret beach for the ultimate in quality leisure time .
